alert.note: Alert for Dallas; Ellis; Johnson; Tarrant (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 14 at 4:49PM CDT until June 14 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Johnson County in north central Texas... Southeastern Tarrant County in north central Texas... Northern Ellis County in north central Texas... Southern Dallas County in north central Texas... * Until 545 PM CDT. * At 449 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mansfield, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. * Locations impacted include... Dallas, Arlington, Grand Prairie, Mesquite, Mansfield, Desoto, Cedar Hill, Duncanville, Lancaster, Waxahachie, Balch Springs, Ennis, Midlothian, Seagoville, Glenn Heights, Red Oak, Kennedale, Everman, Hutchins and Alvarado. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35E between mile markers 402 and 421. Interstate 20 between mile markers 456 and 485. Interstate 45 between mile markers 257 and 280. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection get inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning can kill.
